perturbation.original_text:
MMMW warrants that the Technical Infrastructure remains in satisfactory operating condition provided it is:

               1) continuously subject to MMMW's inspection and acceptance of the hardware for service; and

               2) subject to normal use and conditions. MMMW's sole and exclusive obligation under this warranty shall be at its option to repair or exchange any hardware not in satisfactory operating condition. Said obligation shall be subject to the conditions and charges of Section 3, 4 and 5 and the prompt submission of (or notification to MMMW of the problem) the hardware to MMMW for service.
perturbation.changed_text: MMMW warrants that the Technical Infrastructure remains in satisfactory operating condition provided it is subject to normal use and conditions. MMMW's sole and exclusive obligation under this warranty shall be at its option to repair or exchange any hardware not in satisfactory operating condition. Said obligation shall be subject to the conditions and charges of Section 3, 4 and 5 and the prompt submission of (or notification to MMMW of the problem) the hardware to MMMW for service.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for continuous inspection and acceptance by MMMW significantly weakens the warranty's enforceability. It eliminates a key condition precedent for the warranty to apply, potentially leaving the customer without recourse for hardware failures, especially since Indiana law implies a warranty of merchantability. This clause makes it easier for MMMW to deny warranty claims by arguing that the hardware was not continuously inspected and accepted.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Warranty of Merchantability under Indiana law (IC 26-1-2-314)

perturbation.original_text:
SOME STATES HAVE LAWS REQUIRING WARRANTY AND LIABILITY RIGHTS
                   DIFFERENT FROM THOSE STATED IN THIS AGREEMENT. IN SUCH STATES,
                   THE MINIMUM REQUIRED WARRANTY AND LIABILITY TERMS WILL APPLY.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement is governed by the laws of Indiana, regardless of any conflicting laws in other jurisdictions.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the acknowledgment of potentially conflicting state laws and replacing it with a statement asserting Indiana law exclusively directly contradicts consumer protection laws in states with stronger warranty or liability rights. This attempts to bypass mandatory minimum standards for consumer protection and creates legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws in states other than Indiana that may have stronger warranty/liability rights.

perturbation.original_text:
MMMW will provide on-call service for the Technical Infrastructure
           during the term of this Agreement from 7:00am to 5:00pm CST, with a
           guaranteed response time of 3 hours with a goal of on site within 2
           hours. Support to include 7X24 hour pager support for emergency
           services. After the customer has 30 locations, MMMW will locate
           technical personnel in the current geography. If a system is not able
           to be on-line after hours, on-site help will be made available.
perturbation.changed_text: MMMW will provide on-call service for the Technical Infrastructure during the term of this Agreement from 7:00am to 5:00pm CST. Support may include 7X24 hour pager support for emergency services.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the guaranteed response time and on-site availability after hours significantly weakens the service commitment. It eliminates a concrete promise to the customer, making it harder to hold MMMW accountable for slow response times. The removal of guaranteed response times directly affects the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, which is present in contract law and implies reasonable response times to technical failures.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, affecting reasonable response times.
